data.title: The pair of brackets inside the quotes are not highlighted
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version: Win10

Steps to Reproduce:



language set to JavaScript. There is a line of the form:

<"{{alive?{{x-spotted?#FFBB00|{{x-sense-on?#D9D9D9|#BFBFBF}}}}}}">

The pair of brackets inside the quotes are not highlighted "Editor.matchBrackets": true, does not help but when language set to "normal text", they are highlighted
how to edit Javascript language files to fix it? or somehow to fix it?

Ps sorry for bad english

![2017-04-19_7-57-42](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/27765429/25172275/236cbb58-24f9-11e7-95dc-1e4c53728042.gif)

data.title: Copy-paste from vim in terminal window
data.body:
I'm using OSX and if I use a terminal in vscode and then edit a file with vim in this terminal window I cannot copy text from it to an open file in vscode. It's possible to copy directly from the terminal (less/more <file>) but not from vim.

Might be a OSX/vim issue, but it would be great if this worked.

data.title: vertical/horizontal split window
data.body:
It would be good if it was possible to split windows both horizontal and vertical at the same time. Right now it seems to only be possible to be one or the other for all window panes.

It would be great if it had support for same layout as for vim (:sp/:vsp). Hence, splitting one window pane horizontally and at the same time have two window panes horizontally divided.

data.title: webkit-mask for status bar icons (fixes #23526)
vscode ignores xkb remapping
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.1 onwards
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Remap keys using xkb (https://askubuntu.com/questions/325272/permanent-xmodmap-in-ubuntu-13-04/347382#347382?newreg=4eb097870a15490ebbe39d78412f9797)
2. Test your remapping, they should work everywhere system-wide.
3. Since updating to vscode 1.11.1, it has been ignoring these remaps.

Happens on both of my computers (Lenovo X250 running Elementary OS and desktop pc with Ubuntu 16.04)

Also, after remapping everything inside VSCode, updating to 1.11.2 removed them again.

data.title: Explorer refresh issue again
data.body:
Reviving https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/19377

It's possible I'm misunderstand the design. If the explorer is intended to stay in sync and does so, why have a refresh button? Saw the discussion at https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/17354#issuecomment-267524776.

- VSCode Version: Version 1.12.0 (1.12.0) (running OSS Dev)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.5 (15F34)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open up the vscode repository. 
2. Open `node_modues` folder in explorer and navigate to around `rcedit` to see the proper location.
3. Toggle internal terminal and run npm install `react-grid-layout --save`
4. Notice that `react-grid-layout` has not showed up.
5. Click the refresh button in top right of explorer. Notice that react-grid-layout now appears. Incidentally, refresh is a jarring experience and you lose your place in the editor.

I built it from source (is there a live or hot reload functionality? or at least an automatic restart? didn't seem to have it) and dropped a few console logs in the explorerView.ts file. It seems to run `shouldRefreshFromEvent()` when I add and delete; noticed it getting as far as https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/a9c372aa55243b8c6e181c337504861df54bba66/src/vs/workbench/parts/files/browser/views/explorerView.ts#L556.

Happy to do some more investigating if nececcary but I'd prefer to get livereload or even the debugger working first...

data.title: search bug: "whole word" toggles appearance of results in non-loaded files
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a c++ project with some '#include' statements in some files
2. close all editor windows
3. open search panel, clear ALL search flags (case, word, regex)
4. search for "#include" (without quotes). NOTE: search results appear
5. turn ON 'Match whole word'. NOTE search results dissappear. ok...
6. open a c++ file containing the text '#include'
7. repeat the search. NOTE: the search results include the text contained in the open file.

this is inconsistent. either 'match whole word' should match '#include', or it shouldn't. but it shouldn't depend on whether or not the file is open in the editor.


- VSCode Version: Code 1.11.2 (6eaebe3b9c70406d67c97779468c324a7a95db0e, 2017-04-13T08:01:14.464Z)

data.title: Feature Request: Ability to explicitly set PATH
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.12.0-insider (1.12.0-insider)
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.6 (15G31)

Could there be a way to just set the PATH variable explicitly in VS Code so that I don't have to muck around with my existing (and working!) .bashrc?

I'm on day two of trying out VS Code and I'm hitting this: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/21655 when using the XDebug and PHPCS plugins. 

I know making it _Just Work_ would be great too, but really I'd rather be debugging my code than my editor's code and if a setting could be added so that I and everyone who keeps hitting the `Unable to locate ...` issue could do that, that'd be awesome.

data.title: Intellisense for Emmet
data.body:
Allow basic Emmet tab completions to appear in Intellisense suggestions for typing completions. If I am right, the suggestions I get when I type is called Intellisense. If yes, then tags like

or of Emmet are shadowed by Intellisense suggestions by which typing p or head and pressimg tab doesn't gets completed by Emmet but by Intellisense suggestions. While typing complex Emmet expansions like ul>li*3 doesn't get interfered by Emmet, typing p for

does. I just want to get Intellisense for basic Emmet expansions.

data.title: Add Markdown.trace Messaging to Diagnose Issues With the Markdown Extension
data.body:
**Problem**
For issues with the markdown preview such as #22995, we currently do not have a story for diagnosing what is going wrong besides asking users to debug themselves

**Request**
Add a basic logger for the markdown extension so that users can enable and share the logs from. This should help us investigate issues

data.title: Backspace can not erase the last one character during Chinese/Japanese IME conversion (macOS)
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12-Insiders
- OS Version: macOS

The same issue as https://github.com/electron/electron/issues/9173

Reproduce steps:

1. Open any markdown file, preview
2. Go to Search Viewlet or Git Viewlet
3. Switch to Japanese IME
4. Type Japanese, and then delete
5. You have to press Delete twice when deleting last character.

data.title: Fix #24861. Stop propagation for keyDown events if the IME is processing key input
data.body:
Make sure our keybinding service doesn't handle keyDown events if they are used for composition.

cc @alexandrudima @Tyriar

data.title: Compound debug configurations not shown after first breakpoint is hit.
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.12.0-insiders - OS Version: El Capitan Steps to Reproduce: 1. Launch a compound configuration ```json { // Use IntelliSense to learn about possible Node.js debug attributes. // Hover to view descriptions of existing attributes. // For more information, visit: https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=830387 "version": "0.2.0", "configurations": [ { "type": "node", "request": "launch", "name": "Launch Program", "program": "${workspaceRoot}/server.js", "env": { "NODE_ENV": "local" }, "preLaunchTask": "build:server", "outFiles": [ "${workspaceRoot}/dist-server/**/*.js" ] }, { "type": "chrome", "request": "launch", "name": "Launch Chrome", "url": "http://localhost:6615", "webRoot": "${workspaceRoot}/dist-client", "userDataDir": "${env:HOME}/.chrome-debug", "sourceMapPathOverrides": { "*": "${workspaceRoot}/*" } } ], "compounds": [ { "name": "Client/Server", "configurations": ["Launch Program", "Launch Chrome"] } ] } ``` 2. Observe the debug floating menu has both configurations shown. 3. Hit a breakpoint in the code. 4. Observe that the context menu no longer shows any of the options, and doesn't allow you to switch between them. *This remains until the restart button is pressed.*

data.title: Opening PowerShell script from Explorer Open With on Windows Server 2012 R2 causes the file to open in another user's session

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.11.2
- OS Version:  Windows Server 2012 R2
- Extensions:  PowerShell 0.12.2 (behavior observed with enabled and disabled)

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Install VS Code on a host that is a member of a domain with at least one trusted domain
2.  Create two users, one in each domain with the same SamAccountName
3.  Establish a session for each user to the host
4.  Open VS Code in one RDP session
5.  Switch to other RDP session
6.  Open File Explorer and navigate to a folder containing one or more PowerShell scripts
7.  Select a file that is NOT open in the VS Code instance launched in Step 4.
8.  Right-click on the PowerShell script and select Visual Studio Code from the "Open with" context menu.
    NOTE:  The context entry for Visual Studio Code was manually created via "Choose default program..."
9.  Observe that VS Code does not launch in the current RDP session
10.  Switch to the first RDP session
11.  Observe that the file from Step 8 is now open in VS Code in the other user's RDP session.

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new directory: "mkdir mytest"
2. Launch VSCode: "code mytest"
3. In Debug mode: select settings icon and choose "Node" app
4. Create "index.js"
5. Type "process."

Intellisense will not recognize it but will recognize "console.".

It will work if I take code from another app (cannot see a pattern but say 100 lines) then intellisense for "process." will show up and continue working even after I erase all the lines of code and restart typing.
